Instrument_description: Psychological Acculturation Scale, an adolescent-report scale assessing feelings of belonging and emotional attachment to Dutch and Moroccan people and culture.
Adult Self-Report (ASR), a self-report scale for parents and young adults assessing internalizing and externalizing problems.
Adult Temperament Questionnaire - Effortful Control, a youth-report scale assessing activation control, attentional control, inhibitory control etc.
Ages and Stages Questionnaire - Social Emotional (ASQ-SE), a parent and teacher report of social emotional development, communication, and social skills
Antisocial Process Screening Device (AP), a parental-report scale assessing child's psychopathic traits.
Balanced Relatedness Scale, a self-report scale assessing tolerance of differing opinions in dyadic relationships.
BIS/BAS, self-report scale assessing the strength of the behavioral inhibition and the behavioral activation systems, such as reward, drive, funseeking, etc.
Big Five, a self-report scale assessing Openness to Experience, Conscientiousness, Extraversion, Agreeableness and Emotional Stability.
Confusion, Hubbub and Order Scale (CHAOS), a parent report to assess environmental structure and household chaos
Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL), a parent report and teacher report (TRF) to assess child problem behavior
Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), adolescent report on depressive symptoms
Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, a youth-reported scale assessing physical and emotional neglect, as well as physical, emotional, and sexual abuse.

Instrument_name: Children's Report of Parental Behavior Inventory (CRPBI)
Instrument_description: Children's Report of Parental Behavior Inventory (CRPBI), a youth report assessing child perception of parental behavior (psychological control)
Comprehensive Early Childhood Parenting Questionnaire (CECPAQ), a parent report to assess parental discipline
Conflict Awareness, a youth-report scale (based on Grych & Fincham, 1993) on how adolescents and siblings perceive parents to argue with each other.
Conflict Resolution Styles Inventory (CRSI), a self-report scale to assess how people deal with conflicts, such through conflict engagement, problem solving, withrdawal and/or compliance.
Observations of a parent-adolescent task, assessing how much positive affect, negative affect, autonomy, and dominance are displayed by both parents and adolescents during the task.
Saliva collection in a tube to assess Cortisol Awakening Response
Daily Hassles Questionnaire, a parent-report scale assessing everyday burdens.
Daily Mood Device, a self-report scale to assess emotions and primary, secondary and background feelings.
Observed snack and gift delay to assess self-regulation and behavioral control (child visual attention, verbal action, hands, affect, arousal)
Delinquency - Self-Report of Delinquent Behavior (ZD), a youth self-report scale assessing frequency and variety of delinquency, as well as specific forms of delinquency.
Delinquent Friends/Basic Questionnaire Peers (BL), a youth self-report scale assessig level of delinquent behavior of friends, intensity of contact with peers etc.
Demographic information (gender, age, child gender, child age, etc.)
Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children (DISC-IV), a diagnostic interview conducted with mothers to identify ADHD, AD, HD, ODD, CD or any other DSM-IV disruptive disorder of the child.

Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale - DERS, a self-report questionnaire assessing aspects of emotion regulation, such as emotional awareness, emotional clarity, impulse control, difficulties with goal-directedness etc.
Self-report assessing direct, indirect, and passive aggression
Disclosure/Secrecy (DS), a self-report scale based on the Self-concealment Scale (Larson & Chastain, 1990), assessing disclosure and secrecy in the relationship with the partner.
Observations of a parent-adolescent task, assessing how much positive affect, negative affect, autonomy, and dominance are displayed by both parents and adolescents during the task.
Empathy Task, a laboratory task assessing motor, cognitive, and affective empathic responses, as well as heart rate reactivity.
Home observation (free), assessing physical and social-emotional environment of the child and features of the household
Observation of semi-structured free play (toys, tower building, clean-up)
Identity Styles Inventory, a self-report scale assessing 3 identity styles and identity commitment.

Instrument_name: Index of Empathy for Children and Adolescents (IECA)
Instrument_description: Adolescent-report scale to assess empathy
(Brief) Infant–toddler social and emotional assessment ((B)ITSEA), a parent report to assess child social emotional development (empathy, peer aggression)
Interpersonal Conflict Questionnaire (ICQ), a self-report scale to assess level and affect of conflict in interpersonal relationships.
Interpersonal Reactivity Index, a youth-report scale assessing emotional and cognitive facets of empathy.
Iowa Gambling Task, a laboratory task assessing sensitivity to reward and punishment, as well as sensitivity to long-term consequences.
Level of Expressed Emotion, a youth- and parent-report scale assessing perceptions of expressed emotion and emotional climate, such as lack of support, intrusiveness, criticism etc.
Life History Calendar, self-report on important life events
Parent report about developmental stages

Network of Relationships Inventory, a parent- and adolescent-reported scale assessing the degree to which the parent-adolescent relationship is characterized by support, power, and negative interactions.
Nijmeegse Opvoedingsvragenlijst (NOV), a parent report to assess parental responsiveness
Nijmeegse Ouderlijke Stress Index - Acceptance (NOSI-acc), a parent report to assess parental acceptance
Nijmeegse Ouderlijke Stress Index - Competence (NOSI-Com), a parent report to assess parental sense of competence

Observed tasks to assess child nonverbal communication skills (Follow commands, Object Spectacle, Turn-taking, Social Interaction, Gaze Following, Response to Invitation, Book presentation, Plastic Jar, Social Imitation)
Parental Care and Tenderness questionnaire, a self-report scale (based on Buckels, Beall, Hofer, Lin, Zhou, & Schaller, 2015) assessing how much people like, protect and care for infants and babies.
Parental Dimensions Inventory, a parent-report scale assessing consistency in parental behavior.
Parental Management of Peers Inventory, a parent-reported scale assessing how much parents prohibit their children from having certain peers as friends.

Parenting Practices Scale, a parent-, and adolescent-report scale assessing how much parents monitor, control, and solicit information from their children, as well as how much children disclose to their parents.
Patiënten Gezondheidsvragenlijst (PHQ) to diagnose depression
Pill Use, a youth self-report scale addressing hormonal contraception pill use.
Police and Judicial Contact, a self-report scale (based on suggestions by the Netherlands Institute for the Study of Crime and Law Enforcement) to assess police and judicial contact in the last year.
Postpartum Bonding Scale (PBS), a parent report to assess parental acceptance and parent-infant relationship
Parent report about pregnancy and prenatal development (physical weight/height information, IVF, planned, complications)
Proactive/Reactive Aggression, a youth self-report scale, assessing proactive and reactive physical, relational, and victim aggression.
Self-report scale to assess prosocial behavior.
Psychological Control Scale, a scale reported by adolescents on how much they perceive parents trying to psychologically control them.
Pubertal Development Scale, a youth-reported scale assessing body development.
Leiden Public Speaking Task, a laboratory task (observed behavior) assessing physiological reactivity in social evaluation.
Rejection Sensitivity Questionnaire, a youth self-report scale assessing how sensitive to rejection the participant is.
Participant's religious belief
Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale (RADS), a youth self-report scale assessing dysphoric mood, anhedonia/negative affect, negative self-evaluation, and somatic complaints.

Instrument_name: Saliency importance of friends/Perception similarity friends (SA)
Instrument_description: Saliency importance of friends/Perception similarity friends, an adolescent-report scale assessing the importance of similarity between friends in delinquency, school motivation and relationship, and the perceptions of similarity between friends in delinquency, school motivation and friendship.

Instrument_name: Saliva to assess DNA and DNA methylation
Instrument_description: Collection of participant saliva in order to get their genotype and DNA methylation levels.
School Performance, a youth-report scale assessing functioning level at school

Instrument_name: Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED)
Instrument_description: Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED), a youth self-report scale assessing a variety of anxiety problems, such as somatic and panic symptoms, school phobia, social anxiety, generalized anxiety, and separation anxiety.
Self-Concept Clarity Scale, a self-report scale assessing the extent to which the self-image is clear, confidently defined, internally consistent, and stable over time.
Self-Efficacy in the Nurturing Role (SENR), a parent report to assess parental self-efficacy
Self-reported scale to assess sexual experiences.
Stop Signal Task, a laboratory task assessing inhibitory control.
Strenghts and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a parent report to assess peer relationships
Strenghts and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a parent report to assess child prosocial behavior (24m)
Substance Use, an adolescent- and parent-report scale assessing onsumption of alcohol, cigarettes, and/or drugs.
Parent report to assess smoking and use of alcohol, soft- and harddrugs during pregnancy
Infant Behavior Questionnaire (IBQ), a parent report on child behavioral control (temperament and emotion regulation)

Instrument_name: Temperament, Emotion Regulation, Impulsivity, Inhibitory Control (ECBQ-S, CBQ)
Instrument_description: Early Childhood Behavior Questionnaire (ECBQ) / Childhood Behavior Questionnaire (CBQ), a parent report to assess child temperament

Time Spent with Others, an adolescent-reported, two-item scale, based on the question “How much free time do you spend with each of these persons?” from the Network of Relationship Inventory (NRI; Furman & Buhrmester, 1985).
Triangular Love Scale, a self-report scale addressed by youth to assess intimacy, passion, and commitment in an intimate/romantic relationship.

Utrecht-Management of Identity Commitments Scale, a youth self-report scale assessing commitment to best friend, partner, school and work, an in-depth exploration of best friend, partner, school and work and best friend, partner, school and work reconsideration.
Victimization, a self-report scale (based on Nieuwbeerta, 2002) assessing the degree to which adolescents have been subject to others' delinquent and aggressive behaviors.
Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children, a subset of the WISC tests, including Block Design and Vocabulary, to assess general intelligence.
Work Presentation, a youth-report scale assessing functioning level at work.
Youth Self-Report (YSR), an adolescent-report scale assessing externalizing psychopathology.
